definition: see 邪道[xie2 dao4]
old variant of 邪[xie2]
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: The temptations of the big city soon led him astray.
sentences.chinese: 大城市里的种种诱惑很快把他引向邪路。

sentences.english: I eventually understand why I have walked on a wrong way with kind intentions.
sentences.chinese: 终于明白了自己为什么会报着善念走上邪路。

sentences.english: He used to be a very reliable and trustworthy person, but he has gone off the rails recently.
sentences.chinese: 他以前是个非常诚实可靠的人，可是近来走上了邪路。

sentences.english: As soon as the restraint put on him by his father is released, he goes wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲对他的管束一放松，他就走邪路。

sentences.english: Children are easy to go awry without parental control.
sentences.chinese: 孩子没有父母的照管容易走上邪路。

sentences.english: Personal grievances or financial inducements will always lure some off the straight and narrow.
sentences.chinese: 个人恩怨或金钱诱惑总是能导致某些人走上邪路。

sentences.english: He finally took to evil ways.
The young man is rather weak and may be easily led astray by bad companions.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻人意志薄弱，很容易被坏人引入邪路。

sentences.english: I have kept my feet from every evil path so that I might obey your word.
sentences.chinese: 我禁止我脚走一切的邪路，为要遵守你的话。

sentences.english: An errant husband is one who leaves his wife for other women.
sentences.chinese: 走邪路的丈夫是指离开自己的妻子去跟别的女人私通。

sentences.english: He was perverted by his evil companions.
sentences.chinese: 他的坏伙伴使其走入邪路。

sentences.english: He was ledastray by a hooligan.
sentences.chinese: 他被一个流氓引上了邪路。

sentences.english: She believes in me and I would never do another crooked thing for the whole world.
sentences.chinese: 她信任我，而我无论如何也不能再走邪路了。

sentences.english: This novel is likely to lead teenagers astray.
sentences.chinese: 这本小说有可能把青少年引上邪路。

sentences.english: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.
sentences.chinese: 我禁止我脚走一切的邪路，为要遵守你的话。

definition: fork in a road/wrong road
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
dishonest practices
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
old road/familiar way/beaten track/conventional behavior
the right way
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
lit. Mt Zhongnan is a shortcut to a ministerial job (idiom); fig. to take a shortcut to promotion
winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
the way back/return route
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
to have bad consequences
